title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 44.4 - Chinese mitten crabs (eriocheir sinensis)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 44.4 - Chinese mitten crabs (eriocheir sinensis)

State Regulations
(a) No person shall liberate Chinese mitten
crabs (Eriocheir sinensis) into the waters of the State. (b) No person shall possess, import, transport, buy, sell or offer to buy or sell Chinese mitten crabs, whether
alive or dead, in New York State. (c) Chinese mitten crabs, except those
lawfully held pursuant to a license or permit issued under section
11-0515
of
the Environmental Conservation Law, shall be destroyed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§
44.4

Renumbered from 44.6

New

York State Register July 10, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 28, eff. 7/10/2024

New

York State Register May 7, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 18, eff. 5/7/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. (a) No
person
shall liberate Chinese mitten crabs (Eriocheir sinensis) into the waters of the State. (b) No
person
shall possess, import, transport, buy, sell or offer to buy or sell Chinese mitten crabs, whether alive or dead, in New York State. (c) Chinese mitten crabs, except those lawfully held pursuant to a license or permit issued under section 11-0515 of the Environmental Conservation Law, shall be destroyed. Notes
